meanings.definition: Stretched in the direction of the polar axis, as a spheroid generated by rotating an ellipse about its longer axis.
meanings.sent1: The prolate shape of the balloon made it easy to hold onto.
meanings.sent2: The telescope lens had a prolate design to enhance its focus.
meanings.sent3: The prolate water balloon bounced in a funny way when dropped.
meanings.sent4: Her prolate shadow stretched across the sidewalk like a giant's.
meanings.sent5: The prolate figure of the skyscraper towered over the city skyline.

meanings.definition: To extend or lengthen in a direction parallel to the axis.
meanings.sent1: He tried to prolate the rope to reach the other side of the river.
meanings.sent2: The gardener needed to prolate the hose to water all the plants.
meanings.sent3: She prolated her bedtime story to avoid going to sleep early.
meanings.sent4: The musician prolated the song to create a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The chef prolated the cooking time to ensure the dish was perfectly done.
